skillTree.localised_description: The finest horses in Araby, bred for their endurance and fiery temperament, barded for further protection.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

skillTree.localised_description: These noble beasts absorb the sun's heat, transmuting it into the burning light that flows over their skin like ripples of brightest flame.

ui_effects.localised_text: Explosion does not affect friendly troops

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

ui_effects.localised_text: Explosion does not affect friendly troops

skillTree.localised_description: Elephants are unstoppable beasts. Trained on the battlefield, they lead Araby's leaders to war, wiping out everything that gets in their way.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can pass through trees.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can fire while on the move.

skillTree.localised_description: Thorough drilling increases the peasants' chances of withstanding the horrors of battle.
This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.
Even from within their vessels the Djinn will protect their masters.
The relentless drive and fury of the elemental spirits, harnessed for the protection of this ward’s bearer.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Sheikhs ensure that there are always enough recruits available for the Sultan's armies.
The Sheikhs of the cities are proud of their troops and especially of their cavalry so that no expense is spared either on their equipment or maintenance

effects.description:
Missile strength: +10% for Bowmen units
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -25% for Warriors, Spearmen, Bowmen, Palace Guards, Arabyan Knights and Camel Cataphracts units

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The fierce Sheikhs of the desert are local leaders, being renowned warriors and military men.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +10% for Nomad Trackers, Jezzails, Desert Riders, Camel Archers and Camel Jezzails units
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -25% for Nomad Trackers, Jezzails, Southlands Warriors, Camel Lancers, Desert Riders, Camel Archers and Camel Jezzails units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for all Arabyan Nomad units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Warriors of great armies are decorated in ornate armour taken from the Sultan's personal armory, even the slaves!

skillTree.localised_description: You have seen many brothers fall in battle, for that is what the nomads are, my brothers.

skillTree.localised_description: They call him the beast whisperer, for these creatures would truly die for him.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

items.colour_text: A fine-blade presented to Arabyan Warriors who have proved themselves in battle, gaining them respect from all.
It is said that Armour fashioned from the carapace of the Dune Scorpion is stronger and lighter than any metal variety.
Those proven proficient in magic are gifted the Rattlesnake Staff by the Wizard Caliph, it is the mark of any good Arabyan sorcerer.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +10

items.colour_text: This strange mystical amulet allows its wearer magical powers but it is a heavy burden some can not bear.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: From a far-flung tribe, their power and wealth is a great asset.
A great man, master of war, risen through the ranks and rewarded with the Crescent Seal giving them the authority to lead a great Arabyan War Throng.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +5 for Arabyan Warriors, Arabyan Spearmen, and Arabyan Archer units

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.
Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:

	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Sharp minds make sharp blades sharper still.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: What this being doesn't know probably isn't worth knowing, so deep is their interest in the world and its ways.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.
Well built, robust. Powerful.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.

nodes.localised_description: Those proved in battle may take a sacred vow to their god Tutankhanut and serve as his mortal champion.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +2 with the Scythan god Tutankhanut and the faction of Numas.

nodes.localised_description: This one ensures that those captured in battle wished they'd died on the field, so great is the cruelty that awaits them.
